He traveled to different towns within and outside Alkadar to make sale of their goods and he always came back to give records of his dealings to Adamo. Sometimes when he lay on his bed at night, he would often wonder about what had become of his twin sister Aghogho.

In this city, rich men who needed slaves to work in their farms, shops or homes came to bargain for the slaves and the slave merchants sold to the highest bidder for more profit.
